column5: Hi all,  There was not much ice here this morning, but that did not deter me. My perseverance paid off and i was rewarded with a stringer of nice 'slabs'.
Thats sooooooooo cool Simon. How do they taste? Or is it to early to ask that? LOL

That gives a whole new meaning to the expression "and under the palm trees at Monte Ray marina".  I like those palm trees much better.  BTW if you don't recognize that expression check out the Blue Ice Reports for Lake Simcoe.

That gives a whole new meaning to the expression "and under the palm trees at Monte Ray marina".  I like those palm trees much better.  BTW if you don't recognize that expression check out the Blue Ice Reports for Lake Simcoe.
What the heck are those???  And please post pics when cooked lol
That is simply unfair Simon. Stop that right now. I'm green, green, green. What do you call those, Silver Crappie? Are they Trigger fish?
nice. they look like lookdown jacks? where are you fishing? looks like Caribbean??
Nice haul Simon,the weather looks a bit better then what we braved yesterday lol.!!!
that's just cruel man. especially with that background. Fish, sun, warmth... arrrrrg.
At least you are on the fish. I'm still waiting for the video of all that slab action.
Are you subscribed to simons y9utube channel?  Its simple gold!
How the heck would you fillet something like that?
That was a surprise opening this post. lol  Neat stuff Simon.  Cool pics too.

Thanks for the replies, I am using my new phone to post on a very sketchy internet connection , will get back to y'all and reply properly soon, video to follow, fishing has been fun but not very productive, still a couple days left to put some fish in the boat so to speak ???
How the heck would you fillet something like that?  They come with a pull tab. Just like a sardine can. LOL
They come with a pull tab. Just like a sardine can. LOL   if I had cup of tea to mouth, keyboard would be soaked loll !
